intro: Antirhea resinosa, commonly known as the resinous antirhea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its bark and leaves are known to exude a sticky resin, which has been used traditionally in various applications. Antirhea resinosa is often found in tropical rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments.
